1.4 OPC through the Office of the Special Advisor to the President on Peace produced a national report on the scope of academic programmes on Peace and Governance in Zimbabwe. As a result of this national assessment, an internship fellowship programme to invest in the future generation of peacebuilders has been designed. This programme is in collaboration with 6 Universities in Zimbabwe and will be launched on the 22nd of October, 2018. 2. National Peace and Reconciliation Commission 5 Year Strategic Plan was developed validated and launched at a national stakeholder conference on the 18th of October 2018. The Strategic Plan is an outcome of broad-based stakeholder consultations at community and national level and will guide the much anticipated healing and reconciliation process. 2.3. National level Peace Pledge convened as a confidence building measure before the 2018 harmonized elections. Leadership of 23 political parties fielding presidential candidates made a public commitment to non-violence before, during and after the elections. 2.4 Following the Peace Pledge, a National Peace Caravan was convened as an innovative approach to localising the pledge and mobilising citizen's participation in peace promotion. The caravan traversed all the 10 provinces and provided a platform for sustained multi-stakeholder dialogue with state entities, political parties, civil society organizations and faith-institutions 3.1 Two confidence building dialogues for Political Party Youth Wings in April and June. In July 2018 the 7 political parties with youth wings held a combined press conference formally presenting their Terms of Reference as a Joint Youth Liaison Committee and their commitment to Peace as well as their endorsement of the Political Parties Peace Pledge Signed on the 26th of June 2018.
